p: It is apparent that pandemic outbreaks of respiratory viral infections represented a danger for humanity in the past, and there are no reasons to believe that they would not repeat in the future. It is as yet impossible to predict the time and place of the start of a new pandemic as well as the virulence of pandemic viral strains. However, there are certain factors that increase the potential for these viruses to spill over from other species (Bobrowski et al. 2020; Gomes and Ruiz 2020; Johnson et al. 2020).
